title: New Year, New Friends, New Outlook - m4m
text:
2016 is approaching and I am determined to make this new year the best year! I am a not-so-recent transplant to Rhode Island and have found it difficult to make any lasting connections/friendships except for a couple of people who I am glad that I have the opportunity to know. I am a gay guy in his mid thirties and I do not have the tight knit group of close gay friends in Rhode Island that I thought I would have by this point. I am going to blame myself because I haven't really put myself out there too much, but I am changing that now.

I am a professional guy, who has a good career, educated, some great friends and a good family. I have my own place, car, etc. I have few hobbies and other commitments that keep me busy a few nights a week, and after my 9 to 5 I am pretty much open.

I am looking for other gay guys, in a similar age bracket (25 to 50 is cool), who are also looking to make some new friends, or a group of guys who is open to meeting a new guy. I know this all sounds so random and not organic at all, but its a place to start for me, hopefully someone else out there in a similar situation is reading this.

I am looking for guys who are also professional and educated. I definitely want to meet other gay or bi guys. I am not opposed to meeting new straight friends, but I am really interested in meeting guys who would be down for a trip to PTown or heading over to Stable for some drinks after work, and most straight guys I know are not really interested in doing those things. 

A couple of things....please contact me if you are actually interested in meeting, hanging out, seeing if we vibe, but do not contact me if you are looking for a pen pal. Please be aware that I DO drink and enjoy a nice buzz, BUT, I do not drink to the point where I lose control, I've left those days behind :) Please have a car or a means of transportation to meet. 

Also, I took 5 minutes to type up this ad, if you could also take a few minutes to type a response more thorough than "hey", that'd be stellar.

And finally, please don't judge me for posting on craigslist :) Like, I said, this is just a start.

title: "Why is it so Complicated?" Someone local.
text: Hello, I am looking for ""Long term"" not dating outside of the relationship, because I believe if you date more then one you can't focus your heart with someone truly and honestly. I'm a 50 yrs old, laid-back, easy-going, fun and exciting. I like to do pretty much anything and with the right person anything can be fun! I don't really have a particular "type" of girl but she must be self-confidence, a sense of humor! I'm new at this, never filled out one of these before but I'm tired of the game, I just want to meet somebody cool smart and fun !!! whom we can make the World our playground. I am down to earth, however I can be wild & have fun also. Someone is fun and likes to go out, good looking to talk to about anything. I am a out going person and always on time waiting. I am an honest, trustworthy man with high morals and family values. I like to laugh,and socialize and know how to treat a woman to feel loved and secure. I like to cuddle while watching movies, especially on rainy days, feeling cozy. I love to give unexpected gifts and treasure a commitment. I'm a homeowner and financially stable. I'm not sure what I'm looking for in a woman anymore. It keeps changing with each relationship that I've been in. I guess I'm looking for someone who I can talk to like my best friend, who is honest, and who is willing to go that extra mile for me like I would for her. Chemistry and attraction are important to me, too, but one doesn't outweigh the other. I think for me there has to be at least a little of each for it to work. I have learned a lot from my past relationships; about what I do and don't want in one. I don't play games because I have no need to. I am comfortable and confident with who I am. I can take care of myself but I would prefer to meet a great women and we can take care of each other. I appreciate the little things in a relationship that help to make and keep it special. Chemistry is key. When you find that certain something in another person and you can't get enough of them.... that's what I'm looking for. Do what makes you happy, be with who makes you smile, laugh as much as you breathe and love as long as you live. Just a normal guy trying to find the right woman for me. I consider myself honest and polite, but I'm a total goof at times, too. I have a good sense of humor and I don't take life too seriously. I'm financially and mentally stable - lol. I've got a lot of good friends and I'm close to my family as well. I like animals a lot. I like the outdoors, the beach, movies, music/shows, going out to dinner, shooting pool, playing cards, home improvement projects, computers/gaming, sports, and a bunch of other things. I can listen to most any music and I'm not too picky about movies so long as there is good acting and a good plot. I try to eat healthy and work out on a regular basis. My job can be real busy at times, but I always have weekends off and I try not to bring work home with me. I like what I do for the most part, so that makes it a bit easier. I do have pic's only send on request. The pics are quick nothing fancy I do look better in person these just don't do anything for me, I am not photogenic. If you'd like to learn more about me, I'd love to hear from you. If you came this far in my profile and if you are a shallow person please just keep moving, I am not the one you want! "WHY IS THE SEARCH SO HARD TO FIND THE RIGHT ONE"? "OMG NO DRAMA HERE PLEASE" People have to let go of there past to move forward! I see this isn't easy! title: Listen to my story?
text:
A long time ago... maybe a decade or better, I found I needed to make some extra money. I posted an ad on craigslist offering to clean, do manual labor, or whatever. Wasn't sure if anything would come of it, but I figured it was worth a try.

An older lady (probably around 50) from Westerly responded to my ad and told me she needed help with some yard work. I agreed, we set a pay rate, and I eventually reported for duty as it were. She was not nice to me, very bossy, condescending, etc. I did the work, and at the end of the day she apologized and said she didn't have any cash on her, but that when I came back the next time she would pay me. I was the trusting sort, so I said ok. We spoke by text... long conversations about nothing really. Mostly about her life. She was a lawyer, she knew this person and that person, she was hosting this big party. Etc. I came back several days later, earlier than I had planned, but she more or less brow beat me into coming back early by telling me I did a shitty job.

Again, no money, again, promise to have it next time. I was kind of about ready to cut my losses at this point, so I went home. I told her I wasn't going to do any more work unless I was paid up front... then things went a little crazy. Because I had been very trusting, and because I had told her many things that I probably shouldn't have... she was able to coerce me into continuing to work for her. All pretense of many was gone, and it was replaced with fear of what would happen if I didn't do what she said. This continued for awhile, until I eventually called her bluff and didn't show up to work. I lived in fear for the better part of a week before I started to relax.

Here is the interesting part... both while this was happening, as well as after the fact... it was on some level exciting. I dare say very exciting... I want it to happen again...

I have an ad up in the providence household services section of CL. It's called "Just a guy housecleaning/organizing". If any of this appeals to you even a little bit, answer it. I don't want to know if you are a real person who just needs some help and is going to pay for it, or if you read this ad.

title: LQQking for a Girlfriend for My Daddy!
text:
I am posting this ad for my daddy! So please sit back ... put your paws up ... 'cuz I am about to entertain you and put a smile on your face! 

My name is Gracie! 

I am a Shetland Sheepdog better known to most as a Sheltie or a baby Lassie! 

Lucky for me . . . I do get plenty of second looks and I love the attention! 
I am sort of my daddy's "chick magnet . . . or so he thinks! 

As you can see he has trained me well in all ways! (I can even type!) You will see that I take after my daddy! I say it as I see it!!! I just had my din din and now it's time for my nap!

He has no clue that I am doing this for him so please don't tell him! 
I really am looking for a nice woman for him so that she can be his "best friend" ... just like I am to him! 

I am smart and educated (Went to Puppy Kinder and Puppy High) ... and so is my daddy! I do plan on becoming a Therapy Dog when I grow up.

I am cute (Look at my picture!) ... and so is my daddy! 

I am short . . . only 18 inches high but my daddy is tall . . . 71 inches! 
I am still sort of a puppy but my daddy is fully grown!

I have one brown eye and one blue eye and my daddy has 2 bright green eyes! 

I weight about 24 pounds and my daddy weighs about 185 pounds! 

My hair color is sable and white and my daddies hair is brown and gray in it! Very distinguishing I should say! 

I have a few whiskers but my daddy has many! 

I don't have to work ... (I am a stay at home spoiled daughter!) but my daddy has a nice job and goes to work Monday thru Friday! I'm a more or less a daddy's girl! 

He drives me crazy on the weekends though 'cuz he takes me with him to go and run errands with him. But if I am a good girl, he will stop off and buy me an ice cream cone or take me to the doggie store for treats on our way home! He does make sure that he straps me into my doggie seat belt though!

I am very neat and clean ... and so is my daddy! 
He tends to be very organized which drives me crazy at times! 
He has me pick up my toys after I am done playing with them all the time!

I do not have children of my own ... and neither does my daddy! In fact, my daddy made sure that I could not have any kids . . . if ya know what I mean!

I have a great disposition . . . and my daddy has a great personality and a great attitude as well! 

I live in a big house that my daddy built for me a few years ago! I have 10 rooms ... and my daddy only has one! But he is the one that has to clean all 11 rooms though! I do help out around the house though . . .. and I make sure that I wipe my feet after coming in from outside! I also chase the squirrels off of my deck!

I have a very big yard to play in out in the country ... and my daddy curses every time he has to cut all the grass 'cuz I just sit on the deck and watch him! But I love to play with my balls on his freshly cut grass!

I have a big heart ... and so does my daddy! 
He tends to wear his heart on his sleeve though and I wear mine on my paws! 

I have never been hurt 'cuz my daddy protects me ... but my daddy has! 
My daddy is not bitter ... in fact he is very sweet! Very easy to get along with and easy to please!

My daddy really treats me well . . . and I am sure he will treat you even better if you take a chance! 

I don't bite . . . and neither does my daddy! We just nibble! 

If you scratch my tummy ... I will be your best friend! 
If you take a chance ... my daddy could possibly be yours! 

I would really like to find a special girl, woman and or lady for my daddy! 

I would hope that she is single, professional, attractive and cute, low maintenance, not have to wear a lot of make-up to look good, honest, respectful, employed, confident and most important, let me lie on her feet to keep them warm this coming winter! Hopefully her feet won't stink 'cuz then she would make me stink and my daddy would not like that at all! 

She must also want to be spoken for by me and my daddy! 

Oh ... she needs to be 5 to 6 years of age. That's in dog years! (Now you have to multiply those numbers by 7 'cuz for every 1 year in my age, you will be 7 years old! Do the math ... :-) 

She also needs to know what she wants and not afraid to go after it! But she needs to be willing to take a chance! 

I don't like drama ... and neither does my daddy! No baggage or horror stories please! 

She has to think I am cute and be willing to get to know me as well 'cuz I am part of the package! 

I don't ask for much and neither does my daddy! We are not selfish and would rather "give" than "receive"!

Well if you take a chance, I am quite sure that you will be pleasantly surprised! 

Like I said ... I am looking for my daddies significant other so that we can spend special moments with and perhaps live happily ever after! Oh ... my daddy loves to go on vacations ... and it would be nice if you like to as well. I can't go 'cuz my daddy says that I need a passport!

If you feel that you are up for a challenge, well please do take a chance and write me back! In doing so, please tell me all about yourself as well as a good way to contact you! Please don't be shy! 

I will make sure that I tell my daddy all about you and if he likes what he hears, well I am sure you will be hearing from him real soon! My daddy talks to me all the time when we are in the house together. I think he thinks that I am a person! I do like the attention though! 

And by the way . . . don't get any ideas 'cuz my daddy is NOT a Sugar Daddy but if you treat me right, I will make sure that he treats you even nicer! And remember ... my daddy really hates to type so please, no endless e-mails and NO DRAMA!!! 

Hope to hear from you soon! Got to go take my nap because I have a busy night tonite! My daddy is going to be giving me my bubble bath and then he is going to brush me and then he will play Hide the Cookie with me!! I can't wait!

Woooooooooooof 
Gracie

title: *********************LOOKING FOR SOMEONE TO SHARE LIFE WITH***********
text:
I want to find a woman that is sincere, honest, and most importantly faithful. I have been more than ready to settle down for some time and I am hoping I can find someone on here that I can share life's joys with and explore new places as well as try new things.

Let me just start off by telling you I have 2 kids and my daughter is 11 and my son is 7 so if you don't like kids please move on to the next person because they mean the world to me and its very important that you like kids.

I work as a bus driver and I like my job and the people I work with.

My biggest peeve is woman who respond without giving me a name to respond to.
That only leads me to believe you are not sincere or serious about starting a relationship.

I hope you are different. I hope you are sincere. I hope you are confident and secure,
and not afraid to send me a nice photo of your face.(The eyes have it for me) And MOST of all , I hope you are REAL.
I like a woman who takes care of herself, physically AND mentally, and doesn't waste her time with small talk, 
or idle chit-chat and gossip. Not into drama or soap opera lifestyles.
I'm not sure that there are any woman out there like that, but willing to keep looking.
I really don't want to waste time "chatting" or "texting". Although I realize some chatting and texting is necessary to get to know one another I do not want to go overboard with it
I would hope we are both here for the same reasons.

(If you've read this far, and seen my pic, you know I'm not your average guy, who posts
his private parts on Craigslist, in the hopes he will find a soul mate. Also, I'm not here for
a one night stand, nor do I care to spend countless hours, days or weeks, TRYING to get to know
someone over the internet.......Call me "Old-fashioned" )

I say, if two people are attracted to one another, (i.e. photos), there should be no reason why they couldn't meet 
for some intellectually stimulating conversation, and hopefully more, if there is a spark.
Honesty and Trust are KEY elements.
The club scene is not the place to be looking for a mate, and a waste of time in my opinion. 
I am a true believer in physical chemistry, and know what I'm looking for in a woman. 
That being said, I am not a "shallow" individual, NOR do I believe that looks are EVERYTHING,
but I do believe that there has to be a "SPARK" or a "TWINKLE", when our eyes meet. 
You obviously felt compelled to answer my post. Tell me why, and PLEASE be honest with me and yourself.
There is something to be said about Love at first sight. If you don't agree, maybe you should move on.

Having been married, I've learned from my mistakes, (we ALL make them),
and believe there is MUCH more to a relationship than JUST the physical chemistry.
I have a lot to offer , for the right woman. I've been called "frugal", but prefer "practical".
I consider myself a very resourceful individual in many aspects. (Also a handy man)
I am very giving, and always aware that there is someone out there, who is less fortunate than me. 
I thank God for all my blessings EVERY day, and just want someone to share them with.

I am a married man with a comfortable life, however, uncontrollable changes have caused feelings and emotions to fade, that I hope to once again experience . Communication is lacking and you feel lonely at times. Sex is minimal or nonexistent in your present relationship, but you have intense physical and emotional needs that you cannot ignore.

You want to feel the passion, affection, caressing and kissing again so you are thinking about an affair. You don't want to give up your marriage or your lifestyle, but you do want to feel excited again.

title: WOW!!!!
text:
Being a man of reasonable intellect I decided to read some of the M4W adds as research to see what other men were posting and how best to compose mine.

In doing so it became very evident that I needed to instead write an apology to ALL the women out there who, for one reason or another, turned to CL in an attempt to find a decent man since I found nothing but debauchery, perversion, cheaters, and "daddies".

It is with that in mind that, on behalf of us regular, normal, and decent men (as few as there may apparently be) I offer my sincerest apologies to all women and completely understand the jaded "all the good ones are taken" mentality you have undoubtedly developed. 

That being said, I will forgo writing an actual post, again offer you my apologies for the myriad of BS you must face as a singe lady trying to find a man, and wish you the best of luck. Afterall, if there ever were any normal, safe, and sane women browsing here they probably already ran for the hills.

title: I miss the connection....
text:
This picture was the first sunrise after my divorce 6 years ago. I saved it because it reminds me no matter how dark life gets the sun will come up and a new beginning is possible every day. This simple moment on my front porch was profound to me.

I recently moved to RI for a business venture. I am growing roots here and love New England!! There is so much in life that works out for a specific reason. I am confident there will be life time friends made here and hopefully a very special relationship with a woman that changes the rest of my life for the better. It is possible to wake up every day and smile because you have a purpose. To provide and protect the love of your life! Everything seems brighter, food tastes better, working out has more purpose, and dreams become real! I know from experience a deep relationship is not all bliss. However like the shadows and reflection on a powerful piece of art, that is where the beauty is found. Making up and asking for forgiveness, showing strength in admitting when I am wrong, tender touches to assure you I am listening is the movement and flow of love. 

I miss the connection. I realize that there is risk in being hurt. I am looking for someone who has similar wisdom and sees the possibility of a deep connection worth much more than the risk of being hurt. I am not looking to rush into anything. Slow is just fine for me. I was married for 24 years and have been divorced for 6 years. Dating has been very interesting. Chemistry is hard to find by itself however when you are looking for both Chemistry and compatibility it becomes more difficult. I do not believe these two important ideals has a body type. I am not blind and I would assume we would both want to have a physical attraction. I am more than happy to provide pictures of me and my family. I would prefer to do that directly and not post to the world to see. If you are interested in getting to know me better and would like to talk further, please put in the subject line your favorite ice cream. Then follow that up with what struck you with my post here. Remember I am looking for a deep connection so more details to start will be much more attractive to me.

If after the first emails back and forth we want to share more I am happy to send you my phone number and contact information.

title: M for W
text:
Looking quality female companionship. Someone to date, share pleasant moments with, enjoy each other's company and develop a sincere intimacy. 

Me:
Physical stats are: 6', 175, excellent physical condition, full head of brown hair, dark brown eyes, clean shaven, light social drinker, non-smoker, white collar guy but looks good in flannel, and let's not forget disease free.
I have the gift of good health and energy. I like to cook and eat healthy while still leaving room for the good stuff. Handy with almost any home improvement and automotive mechanics project.
A pretty down to earth guy here, college educated with a logical and scientific mind. 
Very positive person who is open minded to different perspectives on life. Love to laugh, have fun and try new things; the old "work hard" adage. 
I am confident, extroverted (love people, engaging conversations and different perspectives), friendly (many life long friends), and respectful. 

You:
I am looking for an affectionate woman who is physically in shape. Yes, this means I am not into heavy set woman. 
A good sense of humor is essential. One who can let her hair down and be spontaneous, likes quiet evenings together, the performing arts, riding on a motor cycle, eating healthy. Who can engage in intelligent conversation, is fun and can be playful. 
I prefer someone who can see multiple points of view and is tolerant of opposing views. 
I am located in the Pawtucket area so I would like someone to be within a 30 minute commute.

Moving forward:
I prefer meeting in person sooner than later. Emails are little indication of how two people will be in person and I believe that getting to know someone is a continual process throughout the entire relationship. Meeting upfront determines quickly if conversation flows, if you laugh at the same thing, and if there is chemistry. 

Responding:
Please place your favorite color in the subject line to weed out bogus responses.
I will not go to a web site. 
I will not go to your personal e-mail, or share my phone number (rare exceptions) until after we meet and we mutually decide to date.

title: Let's agree to throw away the script
text: You know the script I mean: it consists of a lot of questions designed to determine whether a potential partner might make a good spouse and/or parent. Or at the very least, the script aims to determine whether this potential partner is the kind of person who might break your heart. If you threw away the script and decided that, for one date or maybe a few dates, you'll stop worrying about your long-term relationship goals, and stop looking for that person who will keep you company during retirement, and enjoy yourself with a member of the opposite sex. Decide that you'll do your part to contribute to engaging, honest conversation. Decide whether you might like to kiss or be held close. Live in the moment. For once. Pics please!

title: Simple. No drama, friendship, trust, more?
text:
I'm in an open marriage so my goal here is simple... To meet a woman (single or married) that has some of the same interests as I do and is willing to be a friend. I'm just looking to email at first, maybe exchange a pic or two over time and then possibly exchange phone numbers to text and talk. I would like to establish some trust and familiarity with you before actually meeting. And by meeting I mean grab a bite to eat or a drink and just be in each others company for a while... I'm not looking to rush this or jump into bed with anyone so for the most part this will start off as somewhat platonic. If we seem to hit it off, I have no issues with talking about being close. However, for at least the first few weeks or so, I'd like to keep it simple.

I'm a middle-aged white guy, average/athletic build 5'7" 150 lbs with salt and pepper hair and a discerning smile. I like all types of media and pop culture, have a decent knowledge of music, literature and politics, enjoy most activities, social drinker, non-smoker, 420 friendly (vape only) and an avid movie buff. I love board games, playing cards, technology and yoga. I consider myself a free-thinker and kind-of a geek. My pet peeves are people who are too much into themselves and/or what their social media friends are doing (jealousy will get you no where), pessimism, and being late. I'm very clean and have recently been tested for just about everything... I'm on no medications and enjoy eating all types of food. Everything in moderation has always been my tagline.

I want to continue to feel good about myself and find a woman that has enough confidence in herself to understand my situation and be willing to give me the time to deal with my life so that the future can happen... this obviously isn't a rush. I have too much to give to let it wither away while my wife is off finding herself. I can't promise forever but I will promise immediate admiration and attention for the right woman... maybe even some very interesting days/nights in the future that will inspire and give peace to this life. I'm ready. Are you?

My wish is that you're not too much taller than I am and HWP... just be open-minded and willing to discuss it all. Oh and smile! I really like to see people smile.

Please put something about yourself in the subject line to weed out spam and know I will be absolutely discrete and respectful to you and your email address ;-] Thanks for reading!

title: "Lifetime"
text:
Lets see! If you think about it, there have probably been tens of millions of personal ads posted in newspapers and magazines, and on bulletin boards or on the internet down through the years.

That's a lot of people looking for love, huh?

I find it very entertaining to see the best of these ads... I myself am fascinated with just how clever or touching some of them can be, or how comical or sarcastic. See, no matter how different we are, all over the world, there is one thing that still unites us in a very common way, and that's the fact that each and every one of us, no matter how messed-up or burned we have been in the past, we all still want to love, and be loved, more than just about anything in the world.

My name is Chris. I'm a SWM, 6', with a muscular build. I am a single father with custody and placement (No drama) I have been told that I am very nice-looking, sensitive, communicate well, and fun to be with. I feel 20 (but I'm not). title: Butterflies - m4w
text:
Contrary to what other people might say, we are not all here looking for the same thing. Similar, yes, but identical, read my ad and then you tell me... 

I'm not miserable at home. I have a beautiful girlfriend. I'm not sexually deprived. I am not "trapped", I'm where I choose to be. So...then why am I posting an ad? Good question... 

I miss that "thing"...and by that I mean that feeling that you can't explain...the anticipation of seeing each other, kissing each other, wanting to tear each other's clothes off, having your heart race from a text message or an email...missing you when you're gone. 

I'm not married, but the fact is any long term relationship might as well be a marriage. You have all the same dowfalls of a marriage, with none of the benefits. You become comfortable with each other, stop doing things that make the other feel alive...and that's what I miss the most...having my breath taken away by another. 

I won't ask you to leave the person you're with...ever. I have dated married women in the past, and although I'm not solely looking to date married, they will receive slight bonus points from me simply because they understand being happy enough at home to not want to lose what they have, but being simultaneously deprived of something they may not be able to explain. 

Physically, I'm a pretty attractive guy. I'm tall (not 5'8 tall either, I mean over 6) but not 7ft, I'm big but not fat or a muscle head, blond and blue, and I'm a very romantic, patient lover who adores every inch of the female body. I am not a whore. If we "click" and decide to sleep together then you will be the only one besides my gf that I sleep with and I expect the same from you. I don't want a one night stand, I would rather have something that would last for years...even if we have to go a couple months without seeing each other. I'm not looking to get caught...I would rather miss you than turn our lives upside down. 

I can't say that I have a preference in terms of age. I know maturity is hard to gauge, but I also understand that I have yet to meet an 18 year old that could occupy my mind for longer than 10 seconds. I'm shallow enough to admit that I have to be attracted to you initially for me to pursue more than a friendship with you, but I will not simply declare the hottest woman to write me the winner. I really want to know that we are similar in our minds, wants, desires, temptations... 

I'm NOT posting a picture of myself on craigs. I don't require that you send one to me, although I won't lie-it'll make it much more likely for me to respond if you do. But not sending one won't see your email sent directly to my trash can either. Honestly, you have nothing to lose by writing to me. I'll respond to everyone, and I'll be honest with you if I don't think we're a match for each other, but that won't mean we can't remain friends...OH, almost forgot, when you do respond to my ad, put the name of your favorite color in the subject line. If you don't, I'll delete it. 

Here's to a great first kiss...

I have a big heart ... and so does my daddy! 
He tends to wear his heart on his sleeve though and I wear mine on my paws! 

I have never been hurt 'cuz my daddy protects me ... but my daddy has!

text:
the world is like a ride at an amusement park

it has thrills n chills

and it's very loud.....

some people have been on this ride for a long time
and they begin to question

because this is just a ride"
and we...........kill those people!

don't worry...don't be afraid...ever...because this is just a ride

title: Boycott Ocean State Job Lot, UPS, Cumberland Farms
text:
North Kingstown -- NBC 10's Gene Valicenti reports that Rhode Island based Ocean State Job Lot is suspending plans for a half-million square-foot, 50-million-dollar warehouse addition to its North Kingstown headquarters. Ocean State Job Lot announced Saturday that it has put its plans on hold in the wake of Rhode Island Governor Gina Raimondo's insistence on truck tolls aroubd the state.
Ocean State Job Lot co-owner Marc Perlman says Raimondo's plan is bad for business and singles out certain industries like his. The suspension of building the warehouse negatively impacts bringing 100 plus jobs to Rhode Island. UPS has also threatened to cut jobs in Rhode Island over new tolls and Cumberland Farms has also called the tolls bad for business.

title: 5 black bitches try to crash white party, get refused, cry racism
text:
PROVIDENCE, R.I. -- Several Providence College Students stood outside the college's gates Wednesday to support five women who said they were denied access to an off-campus party over the weekend because they are black. "The guy holds the door and says, 'Do you people really think you're going to get into our party?" said Adrianna Ateh, a sophomore. A ten and the other women reported being cursed and having bottles thrown at them while outside of an apartment on Eaton Street. "I made direct eye contact with the student on the balcony and I saw him deliberately throw a bottle at the back of Tati's head," said another student, Phionna Claude. "Thankfully, it missed her by a couple of steps, but he was deliberately targeting her with a bottle." "A big gray storage bin of water was dumped over the balcony," said Ivy Barclay, a third student. A providence police officer was at the scene. He wrote in a report that he did not see anything thrown at the women.

So if a gang of blacks want to crash a party and they get refused it's racism? Give me a break!

title: Re: ATM machines
text:
The original poster doesn't know what he/she is talking about. Just another CL nut job spreading their conspiracy fantasies around. After years of working with ATM machines of all types, I know something about how the business works. First, 99% of the time the ATMs placed in stores that the O.P. mentioned are owned by private small ATM companies that have no affliation with the store the machine is located in. They lease the space and pay rent for the using that location, the ATM company makes their money from charging you an assininely high surcharge fee for withdrawing money from their ATM, the store makes money because they get to charge hundreds of dollars a month in rent for about two square feet of floor space.

The idea that stores intentionally have ATM's at their location linked to their cash register system is completely retarded. For one thing the ATM's typically placed in those locations are the cheapest, oldest dinosaur second hand ATM machines. When you can hear an old school dial up phone modem kicking on during a transaction, that should give you a clue as to how fast and modern those machines really are. So the machines don't even have the technical capability to share private information with the store they are located in. 

The other big question is what would be the point? The store already has all the information anyone would need to rip you off as soon as you swipe a card and enter in a PIN number at the cash register. What would they gain by getting the same information from an ATM machine. If anything the truth is even more scary if you are all paranoid about people stealing your financial info, because the O.P.'s claim just involves the store, in reality if you make a purchase at the register and then withdraw money from the ATM, now TWO different companies will have all your card information. 

Welcome to 2016 folks, if you actually think there is such a thing as real privacy and anonymity in the digital age, I have a nice bridge in New York I'll sell ya.

title: WARNING ABOUT ATM Machines around Providence Area
text:
This is a WARNING about using non-bank owned ATM's throughout the state, PARTICULARLY in the Providence area. I'm not supposed to be sharing this information, but feel the public should be warned despite the thoughts and decisions made by my superiors and others (law, investigators, etc.)
DO NOT USE NON-BANK ATM'S TO WITHDRAW CASH...ESPECIALLY at the same store your card was used in a point-of-sale type transaction. 
It seems the store's credit/debit readers and computers are connected, whether knowingly or unknowingly by the store (that is unknown at this time), to the ATM Machine. A VIRUS has been placed in multiple locations/stores throughout Providence and the surrounding area that grabs your PIN # and enables the "hacker" or whoever is responsible for this scheme to withdraw money from your bank accounts, transfer money electronically from your accounts to so-far-untraceable accounts, AND tap into lines of credit if they are available on said card.
BEWARE! Spread the word! Don't become another victim!

title: Let's not spread
text:
The 8 types of herpes virus
Type 1- herpes simplex virus 1 (HSV1) cold sores.....
Type 2-herpes simplex virus 2 (HSV2) genital sores.........
Type 3- varicella zoster (HHV3) chicken pox and possibly shingles later on 20%of people over 60 will have.....................................
Type 4-(HHV4) Epstien barr also known as mononucleosis .....................
Type 5(HHV5)-Cytomegalovirus also causes mononucleosis ................
Type 6- (HHV6)causes Roseola......................
Type 7 - (HHV7) causes roseola............................
Type 8- Karposi's sarcoma...
.....type 1 and type 2 are interchangable - one can infect the other through oral contact an breaks in skin ....
90 % of people will have chicken pox as a child. CHICKEN POX DOES NOT CAUSE GENITAL HERPES.
They are all the same form of virus that affects the skin cells an nerve cells.

title: Herpes
text:
Please read carefully. Herpes is a sexual transmitted disease that's contagious, painful, 
embarrassing, life altering, serious and rooted to sex. It never goes away, it isn't at all like
chicken pox or the flu and requires a lifetime of medication, outbreaks, discomfort and 
a big change in your sex life. What more do people here not get? If you don't think herpes is 
serious then by all means keep taking chances by partnering with those that have it.

No condom is going to prevent it. No medicine is going to stop you from getting it.
Finally, there are impacts to your immune system for life. These are all undisputed
facts. If you're here because you have herpes and are trying to defend it, you're very 
ignorant and this may be a factor in why you got it in the first place.

If you're person infected with the disease bacteria be responsible by advising
your partner immediately. There isn't anyone wanting herpes and you can be sued 
for transmitting.

title: Herpes, shingles, chicken pox, etc
text:
All of these things are blisters caused by VARIOUS viruses, The confusion seems to stem from the causes, the contacts, the method of transfer, the outbreak areas and so on.

But...ALL viruses, all transmitted, all of them gross, painful - AND treated with Valtrex (or similar) - regardless of which virus. 

I had chicken pox as a kid, which came back as shingles (now that I'm old) - same virus, running around inside me inactive for 50 years, yuck.
I've never had the virus that is connected with sexually transmitted herpes (simplex 1&2, eg). 
Cold sores ARE caused by a herpes virus. "Genital" or "oral" herpes is where it occurs, not the name of the virus.

Yes, there is a lot of confusion. I suggest you get your information from Webmd, Mayo Clinic and so on, Though CL might have a number of sufferers, there doesn't seem to be much in the line of disease control.

title: buddy
text: I was real sorry to hear of the passing of buddy Cianci. I was a pretty steady listener to his show. I am glad I caught his last radio show yesterday. I thought it was kinda funny to hear buddy telling his audience who all the crooks were in Providence. Buddy, like all of us, had his faults. I am not from RI, but there is no doubt how much he loved Rhode Island and the city of Providence. Buddy's imprints all all over the city of RI, and he was a large reason for the resurgence of the city. I greatly enjoyed his radio show. One of the things I greatly admired about Buddy was his love of people and the respect he would grant the folks that call in. Some of the other "personalities" on WPRO are just downright abusive and rude to the callers. The worst thing I ever heard buddy say was "throw up a flare when you are about to make a point." Buddy was one of a kind. Providence was lucky to have had him.

title: I assume the younger people don't know
text: The legacy of Buddy Cianci, we all realize that he was a convicted felon but went on to be re-elected severed another 11 years as mayor (it's got to be one of the first times in political history that someone has done so). So take it as you may but he Loved Providence and wanted it to be a major player (which he did). Providence would not be what it is today had he not been re-elected.

title: Buddy Cianci (RIP).
text:
I know the history of Buddy Cianci, but when he promised that he would get a project accomplished for X amount of dollars, it was always done within or below budget (grant it that he received a nice cut) but that is the way RI did business in the day. Look at the Big Dig for instance, the lowest quote that they went with turned out to be a disaster, they had to hire a new contractor to fix what the previous contractor screwed up which I believe was 3-4 times the 1st quote (which was in the Billions) actual quote and they are still having problems with leakage in the tunnels and god only knows what else has to be done.
This was one if not the highest construction projects ever in US history.
Had Buddy been in charge of that project there is NO Way you would have seen anything like that happen. 
Say what you may (I know he F@#ked up Big Time) but as Buddies replacement Mayor Joe Paolino said on the 5pm channel 10 broadcast, there are two sides to Buddy, some only look at the bad but you have to consider what good he had done for Providence, Providence would not be what it is today had he not been in control of operations.
With that said, I know there will be a lot of negative responses / posts, you also have to consider how he dramatically changed the face of Providence and helped to make it what it is today.
Others have tried to take credit for the changes but they are only picking up where he left off.

title: Mayor Cianci, you will be missed
text:
What a shock hearing the former mayor had passed.
I'm from Massachusetts but have been coming to Providence since the early 80's and watched the city change for the good under Mr. Cianci's watch. I met him once at waterfire.We chatted for a short period but you could tell he was a genuinely nice guy.All I can say is what a loss for the good city of Providence. RIP
Mayor Cianci.

title: Raimondo ignoring federal law
text:
In a letter sent to "The Honorable Gina M. Raimondo," Governor of Rhode Island and champion of a proposed truck-only tolling program in her state, the American Trucking Association made it clear in no uncertain terms that they believe that certain aspects of the proposed program are "disallowed by Federal Law."

Governor Raimondo's plan is part of the "RhodeWorks" project which would look to repair, maintain, and improve roads in the state of Rhode Island with a $1 billion investment -- over half of which she expects to be paid by truckers.

When confronted with justifying the focus on truckers, House Speaker Mattiello (who was cc'd on the letter) said that "it seems to me that we are going to get a lot of economic benefit and most of it will be paid by out of state trucking companies."


Earlier this month, the RIDOT published a list of the proposed tolling locations, but Governor Raimondo warned that trucks would be prevented from taking local roads to avoid the tolls. Then State Police Superintendent O'Donnell committed to taking enforcement action against truckers avoiding tolls using local roads. This is a large portion of what the ATA is taking issue with.

According to the ATA's letter to the Governor, the state currently lacks the legal authority to take any enforcement action against trucks leaving a tollway. It goes on to say that even if they did draft a new law allowing them to do so, it would be overruled by federal law which prevents states from restricting the movement of commercial vehicles.

The letter, which you canåÊread in full here, shoots several other holes in Rhode Island's plan to impose truck-only tolling and concludes that the state may want to "consult with the Federal Highway Administration's regional office prior to proposing legislation aimed at restricting large trucks, in order to ensure that any contemplated action is consistent with federal law."

So now that the ATA has thrown the gauntlet, it will be interesting to see how Gov. Raimondo responds.

title: Sue Stenhouse's stupid stunt
text:
Well the beat just keep going on and on and on in the City of Cranston. Have you heard the latest in Cranston's stupidity? Is there something in the water there? 

Now a bizarre stunt has the head of a city agency in Cranston out of a job. Sue Stenhouse resigns after dressing man as woman to improve event optics. Stenhouse, who earned $54,491 per year as director, has been an active player in Rhode Island politics for many years.

She served as a councilwoman in Warwick for seven years and had an unsuccessful run to be secretary of state in 2006.

Sue Stenhouse, shown on the left in the picture, the executive director of the Senior Enrichment Center, recently parted ways with the city following an incident at a press conference at which a male bus driver was dressed up as an elderly woman. NBC 10 News covered the press conference last week at the Cranston Senior Center. Sources told the I-Team that the bus driver for the senior center masqueraded as a woman to make it look good for the media. Video and pictures from the Jan. 5 press conference show the man standing next to Stenhouse and Mayor Allan Fung. The man was wearing a dress, earrings, lipstick, a wig, as well as a tag that read, "Cranston Senior Home Resident." Fung's office told NBC 10 that Stenhouse resigned and that they cannot comment on personnel matters.

When NBC 10 visited Stenhouse's Warwick home Wednesday evening, she at first told a reporter to go away. Then, she opened her door and exchanged a few words with NBC 10. "I've been in a meeting all night being a great public servant for the city of Warwick," Stenhouse said. "Now, I get this (expletive.) And you guys did not reach out to me. And that was a big lie on the news."

Stenhouse was complaining about NBC 10's original story that aired on the 6 p.m. news. She claimed the station did not contact her beforehand. NBC 10 maintains it reached out to Stenhouse ahead of the broadcast and she knew the story would be airing

Before she became executive director of Senior Services in Cranston in 2013, she worked at the Greater Providence Chamber of Commerce for two years. Prior to that, she was the Director of Community Relations for the governor's office for eight years.
Trending

text:
Sparky like the rest of us that work for ourselves could probably not afford his fair share anymore because it has exceeded what he earns, with his income taxes, social security taxes,property taxes,sewer,water,tangible taxes,fuel,and a host of other fees he is going to work for the government and not for himself and it finally has caught up to him and given a little more time it will catch up to the rest of us that seek to be independent but are taxed right out it. Myself i probably gross fifty thousand a year and i know from going to the same accountants for twenty years who are reputable that the fifty i make after federal,state,social security taxes it gets whittled down to thirty five,then the city takes another five thousand for my property tax,another thousand for the sewer,five hundred for water and five hundred for vehicle and probably another thousand in miscellaneous taxes so i make half of what i grossed. Now lets pay the mortgage,utility bills,car insurance,food and all the other expenses of owning your home and guess what their is nothing left
out of my fifty thousand. I find it unbelievable that what is taken from me total actually pays someones salary for the year and every time that someone gets a two percent raise my income goes down. I also find it unbelievable that the people in this state are not screaming bloody murder about it but then stupidity in this state is some thing we are not short on.Don't you ever wonder why people that work for the government don't scream and yell about property taxes going up it is because for example if their property taxes went up one hundred and eighty five dollars for the year their raises totaled two hundred and seventy five so their always ahead of the game where as you and i are one hundred and eighty five dollars poorer.

title: Jobs
text:
FYI
A class A truck driver can earn 38-50k a year @40hrs. a week. That's doing local deliveries.
Not sure what a over the road driver makes but they get paid by the mile, can only drive 11 hours a day...etc etc the restrictions are endless. Generally OTR truckers make peanuts. Don't attack as I said not sure exactly what they make but for being out 27/7 they don't make enough.
There's very few union jobs where truckers actually make a decent wage with actual benefits but good luck finding one.
I've been a driver for about 15 years. Wages decreased or remaind stagnant while benefits have dried right up.
There's a good reason there seems to be so many driving jobs out there.
1) one of the most hazardous jobs out there
2) hours suck
3) high stress level (go drive something for a while that's the size of a house with all the asses on the road, conditions of the roads, crappy weather conditions)
4) expensive to maintain your license
5) easy to loose your job and license
6) no respect from employers
The list goes on.
The experience guys are leaving in droves. It's not a field anyone wants to enter and when people do they smarten up and leave.

title: Apartment Rant I
text:
Hello. It's Milford The Apartment Pig speaking out on the listings people are putting on craigslist. Fucking idiots out there, these people should be stopped:

1. Listings that are 100% entirely in Spanish. Translation (no pun intended): We are only interested in renting to our own kind. They are saying "We live in America, but Fuck You....we hate you". This should be flagged.

2. The hundreds of people posting roommate ads in the apartments for rent category. There is a separate listing for roommates, o.k.? Someone is looking at the apartment section to find a place for them or them and their family. They don't want to share your kitchen with it's unique smells or your bathroom with the same issue. I don't want to sit on the same seat you're taking a dump on, got it?

3. No pets? Fuck you. It's that simple.

4. "Plenty of on-street parking". Jesus Christ, this one slays me. Really? Plenty of street parking? Does this apply after a 16-inch snowfall when the plows are coming? Can you guarantee me a space near the house every night? I think not. Here's a notion: you have a driveway. Give it to ME and YOU park in the fucking street. I'm overpaying you as it is.

5. Hey, Ansel Adams! If you're going to post pics, try cleaning the fucking apartment first. I have, over the years, seen photos of rooms with litter boxes, dirty clothes (including underpants), treadmills (which I doubt they use), etc. lying around. Also, I don't want a photo of the town square or the beach. I don't live there.

6. This is a big issue with me: if you put BOTH your phone number and e-mail in the ad, and I e-mail you because, well, I have a fucking job (which I would think you'd appreciate), don't send back a pissy e-mail saying (and I quote): "Call me. I don't schedule through e-mails". Then take the e-mail link out, Fuckwad.

7. You may NOT contact my current landlord. I haven't left yet. Why would you want to talk with him/her anyways? If I'm a shit tenant, aren't they going to tell you I'm great so that they can unload me?

8. "I can show it to you Tuesday at 10:00 a.m.". No. See #6. I work. I can't just leave to go look at your palace because it's convenient for you. Saturday or Sunday will be fine.

9. "How old are you?" What the fucking fucking fuck? I don't want to date you, I need a place to live. And you discriminate. This happens more than one would think.

10. Security deposit equal to a month's rent? Um....no. How am I going to do that much damage? Even if you anger me and I go completely mental, I'm not going to do that much damage.

I will now await all of the pansy responses from all of you slumlords out there. Remember to put your full name and contact number in the rant, so I can tell you to go fuck yourself.

title: Giant Piece of Shit.
text:
http://www.providencejournal.com/article/20151223/NEWS/151229726


WARWICK, R.I. -- A Warwick School Department employee faces charges after he allegedly used school funds to purchase more than $70,000 worth of tools, and construction equipment for his own use, police said.
David LaPlante, 48, of Warwick, was charged with five felony counts of wrongful conversion by municipal employee at his arraignment Wednesday morning. LaPlante, who worked as the director of buildings and grounds for the Warwick School Department, was fired after the investigation began earlier this month, police said in a news release.
Warwick police Major Christine Kelley said police noticed a pattern of "suspicious transactions" in the equipment and material purchasing for the district. All of the purchases were linked to LaPlante, she said.
Officers executed a search warrant on LaPlante's home on Fairway Lane and seized "a large amount of tools and equipment," Kelley said.
Among the items were fencing, lighting, wiring, an oil tank, and a household tool set, Kelley said.
Initial investigations revealed that LaPlante allegedly purchased $72,662.67 of merchandise from five separate vendors. He then brought the tools and equipment home for personal use, police said.
Most of the equipment has been returned to the schools, while the rest is being held by the Warwick police as evidence.
He was released on personal recognizance and will have his next hearing on Feb. 8.

title: Random Story
text:
When the Church Bell Rings
It was a warm December day turned cold because I found myself on the losing end of a sparring match with a dangerous foe. . .myself. Sad stories about life's ups and downs are best served for a Hallmark movie, so let's just say that I was looking for a lighthouse to help me find my way through the storm which had become my life. Fate and destiny can be the biggest bitches in the world, but guiding lights they would become on that day, a day in which I would find sanctuary, as well as a savior.
Drifting on a barrio section of the city which was once Park Avenue some fifty years ago, I came across a row of broken down business warehouses. These warehouse looked palatial in the memory of a hundred year old city resident, but they looked like slums in my eyes on that day. One of those little warehouses stood out like a tombstone in a cemetery full of wooden crosses. Engraved on the tombstone read "Boxing Gym." It would seem as if the little house of dreams could see the despair in my eyes as it actually called for me to go inside, It was like Mama calling for me the first time I fell off my bike.
The smell of the place almost turned my away, it reeked so bad that you could almost the air itself. The musty smell of sweat and blood tested those strong enough to take a few more steps into the light. A quick leap of faith showed a litany of saints such as Ali, Frazier and Sugar Ray forever immortalized on boxing posters that covered the shrine walls. Tyson and Duran glared from the entrance as they dared the weak to take just a few more steps to glory. 
High noon was the time as I walked inside the place feeling like Doc Holliday. If you had eyes from the heart, you could almost see all the ghosts of the combatants that had come before, still throwing punches. Jump ropes hung from the walls like sleeping snakes that only woke up for the champions at heart. Heavy bags pieced together with gray duct tape hung from the ceiling like Christmas ornaments. The ring where the gladiators fought their demons laid in the middle of the gym on a raised platform. Those with courage needed only three steps to find their way out of hell, but the timid saw those same steps as a stairway to heaven. It's inside the ring where you sometimes stand alone with your arms raised. Sometimes though you find yourself kneeling before and adversary like a sinner seeking redemption from a saint. A boxing gym, as I would soon learn, is a church for those with no religion, only self-preservation. I felt at ease, I felt at home.
"How you doin?"
I was startled by strong yet soothing sound of a man's voice coming from behind me as if God were speaking to Moses. I turned around expecting a burning bush, but black Jesus stood before me instead. I was face to face with a tall stout black man with arms and legs that would make a tree green with envy. Gray woolen hair and a lumbering walk hinted that at this man's six decades on Earth.
"I'm Don."
Rank air turned rose scented, and the boxers inside the posters came to life as Don introduced himself. Don was a former boxer who trained the incorrigible of society, like myself. I felt comfortable telling this stranger about my plight, looking for something to believe in, something to shoot for. . .a purpose in life. Don had gone through his own rollercoasters in life, and he gave sermon how boxing had saved his soul. . .by giving him purpose as well. He preached that boxing is discipline mixed with pain and sweat, a template that I would take with me the rest of my life.
"Make this place your home," said the minister. 
Don would become my coach and mentor, but more importantly he would become my friend who taught me many things inside and outside the ring which would help me become someone better that the loser who first walked in that gym. Don harped that boxing is not about sport, it's about finding courage to step through the ropes and face the challenges of life.
Five years have passed since I crossed that threshold of hooks and uppercuts. I've held not title belt, but a champion I've become. I am now the greatest, the greatest me that I can be. My church is there for those seeking salvation from the past. My church welcomes sinners and saints alike, and sacrifice pays the tithe.

title: Black man with crazy tattoos on face arrested at Kum and Go
text:
A masked, costumed Black man with a swastika tattoo on his forehead was arrested after a disturbance at a gas station convenience store in Broken Arrow, Oklahoma, police said Friday.

Meet Michael Carter, 36, he was detained shortly before 8 a.m. local time (9 a.m. ET) Wednesday after refusing to leave a Kum and Go store and locking himself in the bathroom. Police said Michael Carter was wearing a red costume, including a mask Broken Arrow Police Department. A worker called police, who said Carter became abusive to officers, Broken Arrow Police Department told NBC News. He was eventually arrested for obstruction, which is a misdemeanor charge in Oklahoma,

He was wearing a red costume featuring a mask and had previously been seen in other businesses including a Whataburger.

title: Florida plates
text:
I thought you had to have an address in Florida and live there at least 6 months and one day. Or have a relative that lives there and gets your mail. But that's dishonest. 
There seemed to be lots more Florida plates here 20 years ago. They must have done something to crack down.
I own a business and I can't imagine taking the chance of breaking the law to save a few grand per year. I mean, there's a cost to doing business...payroll, insurance, fees, permits, taxes, equipment, etc.....plus a profit. Less profit being honest, you say? Sure. 2015 2016 Jubilee of Mercy 
From the Roman Catholic Diocese of Providence

Mission.

Lets start walking the walk instead of just talking the talk. 
Nobody who does and believes in helping is seeking recognition
Its part of their soul and to say anything different is ignorance of you
own void. Talk is just that, talk. Talk is cheap.

The spiritual works of mercy; 

To instruct the ignornant
To counsel the doubtful
To admonish sinners
To bear wrongs patiently
To forgive offenses willingly
To comfort the afflicted
To pray for the living and the dead.

The corporal works of mercy; 

To feed the hungry
To give drink to the thirsty
To clothe the naked
To house the homeless
To visit the sick
To ransom the captive
To bury the dead
